 CriticalSection (void)
 create a new critical section. Initializes internal win32 section.

Detailed Description

Critical section wrapper class. Use for thread syncronization.

Simple wrapper class. Be sure to call leave every time you call enter. If you don't you can cause a deadlock in your application. Watch out for Exceptions. Use AutoCriticalSection to avoid these problems.

Example: 

			class MyClass
			{
				CriticalSection section;

				void Test()
				{
					section.Enter(); //Only one thread at a time allowed past this call

					section.Leave();
				}

			}

Member Function Documentation

void Syntax::Utility::CriticalSection::Enter (  )  [inline]

Enter the critical section.

Only one thread allowed to enter at a time. This function will cause any other threads to freeze here until the first threads leaves the section. Be sure to leave once for every enter, or you can cause a deadlock.

void Syntax::Utility::CriticalSection::Leave (  )  [inline]

Leave the critical section.

Leave the critical section. Only valid if enter has been called.
